original: Jakobsson, Gustav Einar Jakob, kyrkoherde, Nybro, f. 24/1/84 i Arby, Kalmar 1., av Karl J. o. Emma Karlsson. G. 20 m. Gurli Spångberg. Barn: Margit f. 22, Lennart 24. — Stud:ex. 04, teol. kand. 08, prästv. 09, teol. lic. 20. Resa t. Tyskl. m. statsstip. 12. V. pastor i Rapplinge, Borgholm o. Ljungby, kyrkoh. i Mortorp 20, dito i Madesjö o. örsjö sed. 31. Vik. lektor v. folkskisem. i Kalmar 21 o. v. Kalmar h. a. 1. 28. Led. av styr. f. Kalmar 1. barnaviförb. 31-44, insp. f. Nybro komm. mellansk. sed. 31, ut-redn :man rör. samvetsömma värnpl. sed. 41. Skr.: Georg Teobridge, Life of Em. Swedenborg, refer. o. kritik (Kyrkohist. Ärsskr. 17), Kateket. und ivisn :arb. i Kalmarbygden und. 1700-ta;llet m. m. LVOlkl.
translated: Jakobsson, Gustav Einar Jakob, pastor, Nybro, born January 24th, 1884 in Arby, Kalmar County, son of Karl J. and Emma Karlsson. Married to Gurli Spångberg in 1920 and they have two children: Margit born in 1922 and Lennart born in 1924. Gustav graduated from high school in 1904, earned a Bachelor's degree in Theology in 1908, was ordained as a minister in 1909, and earned a doctoral degree in Theology in 1920. He went on a trip to Germany in 1912 with a government scholarship. He served as an associate pastor in Rapplinge, Borgholm and Ljungby, became a parish priest in Mortorp in 1920, and held the same position in Madesjö and örsjö since 1931. He was also a substitute teacher at a primary school in Kalmar in 1921 and a high school teacher in Kalmar from 1928. He served on the board of the Kalmar Children's Welfare Association from 1931 to 1944, was an inspector for intermediate schools in Nybro since 1931, and was a member of a committee investigating conscientious objections to military service in 1941. Among his writings are "Georg Teobridge, Life of Em. Swedenborg, reference and critique" (Kyrkohistorisk Årsskrift 17) and "Catechism and teaching materials in the Kalmar area during the 18th century".
